page.title: 06LAW AND ORDER IN DALBEATTIE
page.content: There has been a {police force }in Dalbeattie since 1890.The most recent police station was built in 1975.There are 6 constables and 1 sergeant.In the station there is only one cell, where up to three or four people may be kept for a couple of hours,after which they are usually taken to Dumfries.The area covered by our police force is about 30 square miles. In Dalbeattie we have two{justices of {the peace,}who act as judges in local district courts.Our nearest courts are in Kirkcudbright.Minor offences are dealt with there.The sheriff court deals with more serious crimes.Our nearest high court is in Edinburgh. There, people accused of the most serious crimes of all,such as murder, are put on trial.
